content.question: The graph shows the market supply (<math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) and demand (<math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) curves for a particular product. If the government imposes a price ceiling at <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The quantity sold in the market falls from <math alttext="Q sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="Q sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.

The quantity sold in the market remains at <math alttext="Q sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> because the price ceiling is not binding.

The price ceiling results in a shortage of <math alttext="open parenthesis, Q sub 3 minus Q sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.

The price ceiling results in a surplus of <math alttext="open parenthesis, Q sub 3 minus Q sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.
The price ceiling will benefit sellers at the expense of buyers.

content.answer: The quantity sold in the market remains at <math alttext="Q sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> because the price ceiling is not binding.
